tracklistEditor.name: Name
tracklistEditor.filtersDescription: Tracklists are constructed by applying filters on the entire collection.
tracklistEditor.categoryWeightsDesc: Adjust how much each musical category is favored. Setting to 0 excludes that category.
tracklistEditor.composerFilterDesc: Control which composers are included in your tracklist
tracklistEditor.yearFilterDesc: Limit works to a specific time period
tracklistEditor.workScoreRangeDesc: Filter works by popularity score (higher = more recordings of this work exist)
tracklistEditor.limitWorksFromComposerDesc: Limit each composer to a percentage of total works in this tracklist.
tracklistEditor.maxTracksFromSingleWorkDesc: Limit how many movements/parts to be included from large-scale works
tracklistEditor.nameFilterDesc: Include only works whose names contain certain words or phrases (case-insensitive). Wrap in slashes for advanced patterns (e.g., /symphony|concerto/ matches either word).
tracklistEditor.enablePopularityWeightingDesc: Weight track selection by popularity scores. When enabled, more popular works and recordings are more likely to be selected. Disable for completely random selection.

inGameSettings.title: Settings
inGameSettings.trackLengthHint: How long each track plays during the game. Changes will apply to the next track. Does not apply to Buzzer Mode.
inGameSettings.audioNormalizationHint: Uses advanced audio processing to balance volume across tracks. Also powers the visualizer. May cause playback issues on browsers on Apple devices; deactivate if you experience problems. Changes will apply to the next track.

quitDialog.title: Quit Game?
quitDialog.message: Are you sure you want to quit? Your current game progress will be lost.

game.quitMessage: Are you sure you want to leave? Your grid will be saved.

classic.name: Classic
classic.description: Score points based on category difficulty. The harder the guess, the more points you earn!

step1.title: Listen to the Track
step1.desc: Listen to the music excerpt and try to identify details about the composition. Write down your guess.

step2.title: Guess the Category
step2.desc: The more precise your guess (work, decade, composer, era, type), the more points you earn. Harder categories are worth more points!

step3.title: Win the Game
step3.desc: The player with the most points at the end wins. Score wisely and test your classical music knowledge!

buzzer.name: Buzzer
buzzer.description: Race against time and your opponents! Hit the buzzer when you know the answer.

step1.title: Hit the Buzzer
step1.desc: Hit the giant buzzer button when you know the answer to score points.

step2.title: Categories Change Over Time
step2.desc: The guess categories get easier as time passes. Early buzzes let you guess harder categories for more points.

step3.title: Race to Victory
step3.desc: Wrong answers cost you points, so be careful! The player with the most points wins!

bingo.name: Bingo
bingo.description: Spin the wheel to select a category, and fill your bingo card by guessing correctly!

step1.title: Open Your Bingo Grid
step1.desc: Each player needs their own unique bingo grid. Open the grid, print it out, or display it on your device.

step2.title: Spin and Guess
step2.desc: Spin the wheel to randomly select a category for each round. Listen to the track and write down your guess. If correct, mark any corresponding square on your bingo card.

step3.title: Get Five in a Row
step3.desc: Be the first to get five marked squares in a row (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) to win!
